page.title: 01INTRODUCTION DOWNDERRY
page.content: The small portion of land in square 4 of this 'D block' relates in all respects to the adjacent northerly block (02280054) described elsewhere. Much of the original village developed here on the flat clifftop land of the former 'Downderry Farm'. Some of the most important buildings of the community are presently situated in this square e.g the school,the church ,the community centre, and the village pub. It is in this square that all the access to the sea is afforded providing a facility for inshore fishermen,residents and tourists which is uncommon in other parts of East Cornwall where the strand is usually isolated by high cliffs.The accessibility of the Low cliff at Downderry has been important in the development of the community.
